intro: Psychotria valeriana, commonly known as the "Valerian Psychotria," is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to the tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil, Colombia, and Ecuador. The plant is characterized by its small, dark green leaves and clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers. It produces small, red berries that contain the seeds. Psychotria valeriana is often found in humid, shaded environments such as rainforests and is sometimes used in traditional medicine.
